symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Potassium deficiency, Magnesium deficiency, chronic nutrient imbalance, poor fertilization program.

symptomPatterns.description: New spear leaf wilting or failing to emerge; sudden collapse at crown.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Palm weevil damage, Fusarium wilt, advanced Ganoderma infection.

symptomPatterns.description: White, waxy spiraling patterns on underside of fronds; heavy honeydew and sooty mold.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Rugose spiraling whitefly infestation.

soilPreference: well-drained soil; avoid compaction and standing water.

symptomPatterns.description: Tip dieback and leaf scorch, especially on outer canopy.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Drought stress or root restriction/compaction.

symptomPatterns.description: Irregular leaf blotches and premature leaf drop.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Anthracnose or similar foliar disease.

symptomPatterns.description: Sap oozing with frass or sawdust at the trunk or branches.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Borer activity in stressed wood.

soilPreference: Well-drained soil; tolerates a range of textures.
bloomSeason: Late summer to fall for most ornamental plumes.
commonPests: generally low pest pressure; occasional scale or mites under stress

symptomPatterns.description: Brown tips along leaf margins.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Overfertilization or drought stress.

symptomPatterns.description: Orange or brown powdery pustules on leaves.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Rust fungus infection.

symptomPatterns.description: Yellowing at the base and plant decline in soggy soil.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Root rot from excessive moisture and poor drainage.

symptomPatterns.description: White film on leaves and curling or distorted new growth.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Powdery mildew.

symptomPatterns.description: Wilting plants even though soil is moist; crown soft or mushy.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Crown or root rot from poor drainage or overwatering.

symptomPatterns.description: Brown, crispy leaf edges.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Heat stress, underwatering, or fertilizer burn.

symptomPatterns.description: Interveinal yellowing with green veins, especially on new growth.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Iron deficiency, high soil pH, or poor drainage.

symptomPatterns.description: Sticky leaves with black sooty mold.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Honeydew-producing pests such as scale, aphids, or whiteflies.

symptomPatterns.description: Leaf spots with purple margins or shot-hole appearance.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Fungal leaf spot diseases (e.g., Cercospora, Alternaria) favored by humidity and overhead irrigation.

symptomPatterns.description: Mushy, darkened base or stem; plant collapsing from bottom up.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Root/crown rot from overwatering, poor drainage, or soil staying wet too long.

symptomPatterns.description: White cottony clusters in leaf crevices or roots; stunted growth.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Mealybugs or root mealybugs.

symptomPatterns.description: Brown patches or bleached areas on sun-exposed sides.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Sunburn from abrupt light increase or excess heat exposure.

symptomPatterns.description: Leaves curling downward and flower buds distorted.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Thrips feeding damage.

symptomPatterns.description: Gray fuzzy mold on flowers or stems.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Botrytis blight.

symptomPatterns.description: Seedlings or young plants collapsing suddenly at the soil line.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Damping-off pathogens combined with overwatering or saturated media.

symptomPatterns.description: Chewed leaves with large irregular holes.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Caterpillar feeding (e.g., armyworms, hornworms).

symptomPatterns.description: Yellowing between veins or general pale growth.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Nutrient deficiency (commonly nitrogen or magnesium).

symptomPatterns.description: Mottled or distorted leaves with unusual patterns.
symptomPatterns.likelyCauses: Viral mosaic infection or severe sucking insect damage.

symptomPatterns.description: Brown, crispy tips on leaves.
